Chief Complaints:

Current Mental Status Examination: General appearance & behavior; Normal Speech: Normal; Mood & Affect: Low.
Issues discussed in Current Session:
Issues discussed in the session:
1. Problems: Patient struggles with heroin addiction. He experiences cravings and withdrawal symptoms when he tries to stop heroin use.
2. Fear: Patient fears that parents found out about this and has to bear consequences for it. He is motivated to stop using heroin because of this potential consequences of getting kicked out of his parents' house and losing his job.
3. Support system: Parents and girlfriend have offered to help him get into detox.
4. Strategies: Therapist discussed behavioural strategies to avoid triggers and temptations and finding alternative activities to alleviate boredom. He helped him to identify adaptive responses to counter negative thoughts and cravings, such as reminding himself of the consequences and focusing on his future goals.
Action Plan: Therapist asked him to identify adaptive responses to counter negative thoughts and cravings like reminding himself the consequences of drug use and focusing on his goals for the future. Also introduced short-term and long-term goals like successfully completing detox and maintain sobriety.
Next session details: Session scheduled after couple of days
